channel.title: LINQ Syntax :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: Let’s discuss some of the more common operations we might want to perform with LINQ. Please note that this is not an exhaustive list - just some of the most common operations you will be encountering at this time. Data Source For these examples, we’ll be using a data source consisting of Student objects. These are defined by the class: public class Student { public string EID; public string First; public string Last; public double GPA; public int Age; public string Major; }And the variable students is a List<Student> that we can assume is populated with initialized student objects.
